bug.author: stiansel
bug.summary: GaussNoise whitens image and can't accept single value var parameter
bug.description:
<denchmark-h:h2>üêõ Bug</denchmark-h>
Using the GaussNoise augmenter whitens the input image as it produces only positive values. Additionally it is not possible to specify a single value for the var-parameter as specified in the readme. <denchmark-h:h2>To Reproduce</denchmark-h>
Steps to reproduce the behavior: <denchmark-code> import albumentations import numpy as np
image_rgb = np.random.randint(0, 256, (32, 32, 3), dtype=np.uint8)
# Issue 1: GaussNoise only produces positive values. for i in range(10): aug = albumentations.GaussNoise(always_apply=True)(image=image_rgb)['image'] if (aug.astype(np.int16) - image_rgb).min() < 0: # The current version never ends up here print('At least one pixel was produced with a smaller value than the input image.') break else: print('No negative pixel adjustments made by the noise generator')
# Issue 2: The var parameter does not work if specified as a single value # The readme for GaussNoise specifies that: "If var_limit is a single float, the range will be (-var_limit, var_limit)" for i in range(100): # This leads to a TypeError: can't convert complex to float albumentations.GaussNoise(10.0, always_apply=True)(image=image_rgb)
</denchmark-code>
<denchmark-h:h2>Expected behavior</denchmark-h>
For either GaussNoise to produce both positive and negative adjustments, or for the positive-only nature of the class to be included in the documentation. <denchmark-h:h2>Environment</denchmark-h>
Albumentations version (e.g., 0.1.8): 0.2.3 Python version (e.g., 3.7): 3.6.8 OS (e.g., Linux): Ubuntu 18.04 How you installed albumentations (conda, pip, source): pip
